Melchana shoots a sideglance at him.

Melchana: Yes, is it not? The feeling of the reformatting ritual is 
also a... strong experience. We had to reformat the whole landscape in 
order to power to our base. Follow me. My brother is waiting for us 
now. Do you want to meet him before you go to the Renewal Chamber?

She rises from the piloting seat and slowly walks out.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "x_rauq_x" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
> --- Firedrill ---
> 
> The young bot's eyes widden at the sight, but he keeps his composure 
> for the moment as The Hellgate rips over Australia. Shortly, he 
> blurts out, "Whoa, looks like, like, techno-organics or something... 
> I've never seen anything like this on such a large scale."
> 
> The ship lands, and Firedrill nods to Melchana, "Amazing..."
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "warriorazure" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > Melchana: So be it. We're almost there. (over the commline) 
> > Belthassan, lower the shields, I am almost at the Shadow Destiny.
> > 
> > The Hellgate was flying over Australia. Beneath them, the 
> > techno-organic land was scrolling fast (is that the word?). The 
> land's 
> > state was likely to provoke some reaction in Firedrill. However, 
> > before them, a huge obeliskofnod-like tower stood straight. The 
> > shields around it lowered. A platform of techno-organic vines 
> formed 
> > for the ship to land.
> > 
> > Belthassan: Done, Melchana. Please come directly, as I said, to 
> the 
> > Storage room.
> > 
> > Melchana: But wouldn't Daemos...
> > 
> > Belthassan: If I have to make this an order, so be it, trainer.
> > 
> > Melchana slowly smiled: Good, sir. Wilco.
> > Firedrill, Welcome to Australia.. Welcome to the Shadow Destiny!
